text: you know that old expression eat your
greens well this garden salad with
hard-boiled eggs and fresh herbs will
make eating your greens a pleasure and a
privilege
now haricot vert may sound fancy but
it's really just a cousin of the green
bean and snap peas these wonderful guys
are edible both inside and out the peas
are crisp and sweet but the pod is
perfectly edible too now these just need
a moment in boiling water and we're
ready to build a salad the key to
successful blanching is starting with a
pot of boiling water and generously
season it with salt the haricot vert
will need about 2 minutes in here so I'm
gonna start with those we're looking for
crisp tender beans and snap peas color
is coming up on these haricot vert so I
think it's time to add the snap peas
then they go I think these are just
about done the snap peas have become
more swollen and their color as you can
see is heightened pop one into the ice
water bath as a test just for a moment
to cool it down and then listen for
snack oh yeah that's nice these are
ready so I'm gonna rescue the rest I
like to set a colander into the ice
water before I place the beans and this
will just keep the ice itself separated
and make it easier and just skitter them
onto a tray and Pat them dry cut your
beans and snap peas into bite-size
pieces I like the haricot vert in thirds
and the snap peas in half and the snap
peas I like to cut on a bias it helps to
show off their little Peas inside there
for the dressing two tablespoons of sour
cream do this a tablespoon of lemon
juice looks about right and anchovies
don't be scared of these they're just
imparting a nice salty flavor just rinse
them and Pat them very dry and this will
just remove any excess saltiness from
them you almost want these into a paste
so you can use the side of a knife to
sort of scrape against the anchovy into
the bowl that goes and olive oil about a
quarter cup I'm just gonna eyeball it
whisk this all together vigorously so
that emulsify
and do a little taste here oh nice still
can take some salt and pepper freshly
ground in that goes okay dressing ready
now to plate I'm only making a single
salad this is enough to feed for some
beautiful baby spinach here on the
bottom of the plate look at that color
wow it's gorgeous and our sugar snap
peas lots of those for me because this
is my favorite and the haricot vert now
you could use green beans or wax beans
if those are what you have in your
garden and a hard-boiled egg for protein
you can just cut these into bite-sized
pieces as well they go so pretty these
are placed in cold water brought to a
boil and remove from the heat and cover
it for about 10 to 12 minutes now to
dress it I'm just gonna eyeball some of
this and drizzle it over YUM
nice creamy dressing and for freshness
and even more green flavor flat leaf
parsley I like to use whole leaves here
you don't have to chop this up and
tarragon tarragon is very pungent so you
don't need much it has a subtle anise
like flavor and this is a healthy
beautiful balanced meal when it comes to
salad it doesn't get any greener than
this
